divs: Sighting Details09I live in Aspinwall, on the corner of Second Western, just outside the borderof the city of Pittsburgh, Pa..09Last night June 25 2003 I walked to the Waterworks Mall to get some things atGiant Eagle. I have to go in an easterly direction to get there. I left thehouse at 1043 P.M. on a trip that normally takes me 12 to 15 minutes. I got asfar as Brilliant Ave. and saw a car on Second making a very slow turn eitherinto a garage or Virginia Ave., about a block and a half away from where I was. I couldn92t tell what color it was, because it was night time. I didn92t think too much of it and continued my walk along Second. By the time I gotacross Lexington, another car turned into Second from Delefield, the next streetup, and drove very slowly, then turned up Lexington. Thinking it might be thesame car as before, it kind of raised my suspicions about their motives fordriving so slowly and circling around those few blocks. This car was red.I was just about to come to a driveway slope in the sidewalk and a low hangingbranch from a fir tree, so I had to be careful about where I was walking and hadto think about where I was going for a few seconds. I continued to walk, butturned to look at the car. Knowing I was coming up to the driveway slope Islowed down for a second as I looked at the car. Out of the corner of my eye Isaw a fairly bright light in the sky. I thought it might92ve been the satellite that can normally be seen from here pretty much everynight.
